description: We offer daily tours from Toronto to Niagara Falls and the Niagara Region. We load the bus in Toronto at 8.00am and we return to Toronto around 5pm. Niagara Day Tour offers a convenient consolidated pick up from downtown Toronto close to Union Station. We do not waste your time driving around to numerous hotels in heavy traffic. We load the bus quickly and head towards Niagara as we know your time is valuable. Our tours Include:- Hornblower Niagara Cruise boat ride (Optional seasonal activity). Photo stop at the Whirlpool Rapids. Photo stop at the Floral Clock. Photo top at the Hydro-electric Power Station viewpoint. Minimum of 3 hours in Niagara Falls. Tours include full commentary from Licensed Tour Guides with the Niagara Parks Commission. Our modern vehicles are fully licensed and insured and have air conditioning and heating.

reviews.title: Amazing day trip to the Niagara Falls
text: We really enjoyed our Niagara day-trip.

The driver/guide (Mel) was friendly and a mine of information about what we were seeing on route to Niagara. At every stop he gave clear information about how long was the stop and where to meet. He also made it easy for us at the Skylon Tower as we could buy tickets on the bus without the need to queue at the ticket office. He also provided cool bottles of water, which were appreciated on a hot day.
We fitted in Maple syrup tasting, the floral clock,viewing the Eddy and the 2 power stations on the way.
We had 3 hours at the Falls, which included the time for the boat trip on the Hornblower, though we could have easily spent another hour there.
The return trip was faster than expected as Mel expertly avoided the traffic jam?
I would definitely recommend this trip.

reviews.title: Great day at Niagara Falls
text: We were picked up in Toronto at a designated location. Our tour guide  - i belive his name is Mel - was a wealth of historical information which made the drive from Toronto to Niagra enjoyable. The van was very clean and in very good He also stressed on punctuality which was appreciated. We added the boat ride to the base of the falls.  It it awe inspiring and I would highly recommend.  The visit to the Skylon tower was also very good to give a perspective of the falls from above.  The stop at the maple factory was just ok but a good way to use the bathrooms before heading to the falls.  We had the unfortunate incident going back as the van broke down prior to pickup for our return trip. They sent us another bus after a 2.5 hours wait which by that time was rush hour. Nothing against the tour operator just an unfortunate thing. Thankfully we had no other major reservation for that evening that we could not cancel. I would recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Beautiful and wonderful day out!
text: This tour was everything and more than I could've expected, it was a fantastic day out to Niagra Falls...this wonder is a must when in Canada, the early morning set off from Toronto was on time, with no rush and detailed itinerary from the tour operator.

Well worth every dollar spent...from pickup to dropoff...with our professional driver/guide Ralph...who shared some history and information along the way, and what other fun activities we can do to make our day even more enjoyable.

The Voyage to the falls cruise is not to be missed with an additional $35.00, it was fun and magical, also the enclosed gondola Sky Wheel for even more great views of the falls for a generous $15.00...these add ons is totally optional while there for 3 hours.

We did a few stops on our ride to the Falls...the Floral Clock was beautiful with its lush flowers and well maintained grounds, along with the Niagra river and whirlpool...beautiful photo stops, but the stop for the Maple tasting was delicious and educational, quite unexpected and is worth experiencing...I highly recommend this tour with the ease of traveling to Niagra from Toronto.

reviews.title: 5 Stars!
text: We had a great guide who was also our bus driver, RALPH.
We were picked up outside the aquarium by our guide where we boarded the bus- easy to find. The bus was very nice and comfortable + offered free water.

We stopped along the way for Maple syrup tasting, flower clock, some scenic photo opportunities, and had about 3 hours at Niagara Falls.  Ralph was full of fun facts and history of Toronto and Niagara Falls + a sense of humor.

The Hornblower boat ride is short but expect to get wet! I wore a raincoat under the red poncho you'll be given at the site. This is the way to do it to get the full magnitude of the falls!  I changed my shoes into flip flops for the boat and then back into my tennis shoes for touring.

You can take an elevator up a tower to see everything from above or ride a zipline on the side of the falls. However, we did not test any of these. There are also MANY hotels and restaurants nearby. This tour saved us so much hassle to avoid renting a car and finding parking. This tour saved us so much hassle to avoid renting a car and finding parking.
Would recommend it! Ralph, Thank you for a very memorable and fun day out. Must do if you are close enough to make it happen! 5 stars!
